tool.name: SAMSpecificObjByBox

param.name: model_checkpoint_path
param.dialogReference: The path of the model checkpoint of the SAM.
param.pythonReference:
str

The path of the model checkpoint of the SAM.

param.name: model_checkpoint_type
param.dialogReference:
You can choose "vit_h", "vit_l" or "vit_b", all of the model checkpoints are based on Vision Transformer, the difference is the number of layers and the number of heads in the model.

  1. "vit_h": encoder_embed_dim=1280, encoder_depth=32, encoder_num_heads=16, encoder_global_attn_indexes=[7, 15, 23, 31];

  2. "vit_l": encoder_embed_dim=1024, encoder_depth=24, encoder_num_heads=16, encoder_global_attn_indexes=[5, 11, 17, 23];

  3. "vit_b": encoder_embed_dim=768, encoder_depth=12, encoder_num_heads=12, encoder_global_attn_indexes=[2, 5, 8, 11].
param.pythonReference:
str

You can choose "vit_h", "vit_l" or "vit_b", all of the model checkpoints are based on Vision Transformer, the difference is the number of layers and the number of heads in the model.

  1. "vit_h": encoder_embed_dim=1280, encoder_depth=32, encoder_num_heads=16, encoder_global_attn_indexes=[7, 15, 23, 31];

  2. "vit_l": encoder_embed_dim=1024, encoder_depth=24, encoder_num_heads=16, encoder_global_attn_indexes=[5, 11, 17, 23];

  3. "vit_b": encoder_embed_dim=768, encoder_depth=12, encoder_num_heads=12, encoder_global_attn_indexes=[2, 5, 8, 11].

param.name: input_raster
param.dialogReference: The path to the original raster dataset.
param.pythonReference:
str

The path to the original raster dataset.

param.name: red_channel
param.dialogReference: The name of the band used to be the red channel.
param.pythonReference:
str

The name of the band used to be the red channel.

param.name: green_channel
param.dialogReference: The name of the band used to be the green channel.
param.pythonReference:
str

The name of the band used to be the green channel.

param.name: blue_channel
param.dialogReference: The name of the band used to be the blue channel.
param.pythonReference:
str

The name of the band used to be the blue channel.

param.name: selection_box
param.dialogReference: To extract the range selection box of an object whose coordinates have the same spatial reference system and units as the input raster data, you need to provide the four values "XMin YMin XMax YMax".
param.pythonReference:
str

To extract the range selection box of an object whose coordinates have the same spatial reference system and units as the input raster data, you need to provide the four values "XMin YMin XMax YMax".

param.name: output_feature_class
param.dialogReference: Config the path and the name of the Feature Class to export.
param.pythonReference:
str

Config the path and the name of the Feature Class to export.

param.name: simplify
param.dialogReference: Determines if the output polygons will be smoothed into simpler shapes or conform to the input raster's cell edges.
param.pythonReference:
bool

Determines if the output polygons will be smoothed into simpler shapes or conform to the input raster's cell edges.

param.name: use_gpu
param.dialogReference: This parameter determines whether the computer will use the GPU to accelerate the computation. Note: If the GPU is not available, even if this parameter is checked.
param.pythonReference:
bool

This parameter determines whether the computer will use the GPU to accelerate the computation. Note: If the GPU is not available, even if this parameter is checked.

tool.summary: Use Segment Anything Model (SAM) to specify a specific object with a selection box to predict its mask.

scriptExample.title: SAM Specific Object by Box Python Examples
scriptExample.para: To call the <code>SAMSpecificObjByBox</code> function in Python environment.
scriptExample.code:
import arcpy
uav_toolkit = arcpy.ImportToolbox('path/to/UAV_Toolkit.pyt') # load toolbox
uav_toolkit.SAMSpecificObjByBox("path/to/sam_vit_h_4b8939.pth", "vit_h", "path/to/original/raster.tif", "Band_3", "Band_2", "Band_1", "{0} {1} {2} {3}".format(xmin, ymin, xmax, ymax), "path/to/the/result_vit_h.shp", True, True)

tool.usage: The "SAM Specific Object by Box" tool is a part of the UAV Toolkit. It utilizes the Segment Anything Model (SAM) to predict specific objects within an image based on a selection box. The tool requires several parameters, including the model checkpoint path and type, input raster, and various prediction parameters. The tool also supports GPU acceleration if available. The output is a polygon feature class containing the predicted objects. The tool is designed to be used within the Python environment.
